msDesc.head: Historical collection, mainly relating to Venice, in Latin and Italian (formerly part of a larger volume); Italy (Venice), 15th century

msItem.author: Eugenius Panormitanus
msItem.title: Prophecy
msItem.note: Perhaps a translation of a Greek original; pr. O. Holder-Egger, Neues Archiv XV (1889), 141–78. For other editions and MSS. see E. Jamison, Admiral Eugenius of Sicily, London, 1957, p. 21 n. 3

msItem.rubric: Iste sunt peregrinationis [sic] Ierusalem et tocius terre sancte
msItem.incipit: Gloriose ac sancte civitatis Ierusalem peregrinationes scire cupientes
msItem.explicit: que vidi et etiam stetit. Hec dicta sufficiant quas [sic] ego Phillipus ad honorem dei et ad utilitatem peregrinorum breviter memorie commendavi.
msItem.note: Pr. W. Neumann, Österreichische Vierteljahrschrift für kath. Theol. II, 1872, pp. 28–78. The text of this MS. is longer than that of the edition by two chapters.

msItem.title: Epistola Lentuli
msItem.note: Pr. E. von Dobschütz, Christus-bilder, Leipzig, 1899, p. 318**

msItem.title: Epistola Pilati ad Tiberium
msItem.note: Pr. E. von Dobschütz, Christus-bilder, Leipzig, 1899, pp. 184**-187** as a letter to Nero in ch. 16 of the life of Pilate.

msItem.title: Chronological notes
msItem.note: (added by two later hands)

msItem.author: Andrea Dandolo
msItem.title: Chronicle of Venice
msItem.note: bks. 4–6; as pr. Muratori, Rer. Ital. Script. XII; with marginal annotations in Latin and Italian, many being in the first hand

msItem.author: Andrea Dandolo
msItem.title: Compendium historiale
msItem.note: (beginning of; cf. Muratori XII p. 4)
msItem.rubric: Incipit cronica per annos domini divisa de urbis et totius provincie initio, constitutione ducum ac laudabilibus operationibus sub ipsis gestis summarie faciens mentionem
msItem.incipit: Cum Deus omnipotens a quo omnia subsistencia sumpserunt initium
msItem.explicit: immo aliis pretermissis ad hoc transeamus

msItem.author: Bonincontrus de Bovis
msItem.title: Hystoria de discordia et persecutione quam habuit ecclesia cum imperatore Federico Barbarossa tempore Alexandri tercii summi pontificis et demum de pace facta Veneciis et habita inter eos
msItem.rubric: Incipit istoria reconcilliationis domini Alexandri pape tercii cum domino Federicho Barbarossa imperatore
msItem.explicit: in pontifichali nostra sede apostollicha autoritate confirmamus
msItem.note: In MSS. Laud. misc. 587 fol. 64 and Venice, Marciana lat. c1.21.21 the author, in a colophon, describes himself as 'Ego Bonincontrus Lig[urus] origine Mantuanus natione quoque Bononiensis tamen verbo et opere totus Venetus et Rivaltensis, domini ducis et communis Venetiarum notarius et officialis'

msItem.title: Life of Alexander III
msItem.incipit: Ab urbe condita ad Alexandrum summum pontificem anni VIIIICX conchutebantur
msItem.explicit: et in eccllesia sancti Petri sepellitur chiu papa Lucius sucessit

msItem.title: Note on 'quid est bonum in mundo'

msItem.author: 'Prester John'
msItem.title: Epistola Manueli Comneno imperatori Graecorum
msItem.note: ed. F. Zarncke, Abh. der k. Sächsischen Gesellschaft d.Wissenschaften philol.-hist. Kl. 7 (1879) 909–924
msItem.explicit: omni genare ciborum essemus repleti (p. 922 of edition)

msItem.title: Chronicle of Verona, 1260 to 1405
msItem.incipit: Anno domini MCCLX mortuo Eccelino de Romano
msItem.note: Ed. G. Orti Manara, Cronaca inedita dei tempi degli Scaligeri, Verona, 1842

msItem.title: Account of events in Lombardy from 572 - c. 575
msItem.incipit: Anno VLXXVII (sic) Teodorichus rex Ticinii vir ingentis animi

msItem.title: Mandate of doge Pietro Ziane to the 132 Venetian knights and 48 foot soldiers sent to establish Venetian rule over Crete, September, 1211
msItem.note: (cf. H. Kretschmayr, Gesch. von Venedig II.20), with a list of 91 knights and 34 foot soldiers. Headed 'exemplum exemplatus (sic) de quodam'.

msItem.title: Documents relating to the Fourth Crusade

msItem.rubric: Sacramentum nuntiorum Balduini comitis Flandrie factum inclito domini Enrico Dandulo
msItem.note: Pr. Muratori XII.325

msItem.rubric: Sachramentum Theobaldi comitis Trecensis et Palatine factum prefato domini duci
msItem.note: The same text as above. The heading only of the oath of the count of Blois is given.

msItem.rubric: Pactum domini Baldwini chomitis Flandrensis et Theobaldi chomitis Trecensis et Lodovici chomitis Blesensis cum prefacto domino Henricho Dandulo
msItem.note: Pr. Muratori XII.323

msItem.rubric: Pactum initum inter suprascrittos dominos in chaptione urbis Constantinopolitanee
msItem.note: Pr. Muratori XII.326–8

msItem.title: List setting out the division of the territories of the Eastern empire between the Venetians and the Latin princes
msItem.note: pr. Muratori XII.328–9. Fol. 67 is misplaced; it should come between 68 and 69.

msItem.title: Letter from doge Pietro Gradenigo explaining his conduct in suppressing the conspiracy of Querino and Tiepolo, 1310
msItem.rubric: Chopia de una letera mandada per la nostra illustrissima signoria de Venixia (?) al nobel homo s. Griguol Dolfin [Gregorio del Fino] baillo in Armenia, dada di XXVII Gugno MoCCCX
msItem.note: Similar in wording to the letter sent on the same day to the castellani of Corone and Modone, pr. G. A. Avogadro, Archivio Veneto II, 1871, p. 216

msItem.title: Agreement between doge Domenico Michiel, and the commune of Bari
msItem.note: Resume; Italian version; Latin text in Marino Sanudo's Lives of the Doges (Muratori XXII. col. 964); followed by an alphabetical list of signatories, differing from all the versions pr. by G. Monticolo, Rendiconti della Reale Accad. dei Lincei, ser. V, vol. VIII, 1899, pp. 162–77 and N.A.V. XVIII, 1899, p. 141.

msItem.title: Note on admission to the Gran Consiglio, and on the closing of the Gran Consiglio in 1297.
msItem.note: There is a reference to the register 'Cerbero' (for which see Kretschmayr II.551)

msItem.rubric: De chronicha magistri Jachobi phisici Olugen. (?) commorantis
msItem.note: (extracts, for the years 421 and 1110)

msItem.rubric: Infrascripti fabrichaverunt aliquas ecllesias in civitate Venetiarum

msItem.title: Comparative list of Venetian ships sunk and captured by the Genovese, and vice versa, 1206–1423

supportDesc.support: Paper. Watermarks arrows in saltire, cf. Briquet 6271; ladder, cf. Briquet 5908; anchor in circle with star, cf. Briquet 485.
supportDesc.foliation: Modern pencil: i-ii, 1–83; remains of a single (?) 18th-century (?) foliation in ink, now incomplete and out of order: 78, 85–91 (fols. 64–71), 122–133 (fols. 54–63), 245–256 (fols. 42–53).

handDesc.handNote: Five main scribes: (1) fol. 1–2, 54–62v; (2) fol. 2v-3v; (3) fol. 4–53v; (4) fol. 63; (5) fol. 64–75

decoDesc.decoNote: Spaces for initials left unfilled by hands (1) and (3)

binding.p: Typical Holkham binding of polished brown leather; the spine lettered in gilt 'TRACTATUS | VARII | M. S.', and with the number '497' at the bottom.

history.provenance: Written in Venice; still in Italy, in the 17th and 18th centuries. On fol. 76–81 is an account in Italian, 17th.-cent., of the conspiracy of Tiepolo and Querini.
Bookplate of 'THOMAS WILLIAM COKE', formerly Norfolk, Holkham Hall, MS. 497.

recordHist.source: Typescript description by Bodleian Library staff, revised by Peter Kidd, late 1990s

revisionDesc.change: James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
